Package de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice

Class WardTestCase

java.lang.Object
de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice.AbstractServiceTestCase
de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice.AbstractEntityTestCase
de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice.WardTestCase
public class WardTestCase extends AbstractEntityTestCase
Checks all Ward-relevant methods of the implementation of BasicDBService and Ward

  • Method Details

    • testCreateWardInvalidName

      @ParameterizedTest(name="createWard with invalid name - #{index} - Arg={0}") @NullAndEmptySource @ValueSource(strings={" ","\t","\n"}) public void testCreateWardInvalidName(String input)
      Attempts to create a Ward object using the method BasicDBService.createWard(String, int) with an invalid name (as described in the interface).
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)

    • testCreateWardInvalidNumberOfBeds

      @ParameterizedTest(name="createWard with invalid bed count - #{index} - Arg={0}") @ValueSource(ints={-2147483648,-1,0}) public void testCreateWardInvalidNumberOfBeds(int input)
      Attempts to create a Ward object using the method BasicDBService.createWard(String, int) with an invalid number of beds (as described in the interface).
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)

    • testCreateWardCorrect

      @Test public void testCreateWardCorrect()
      Attempts to create a Ward object using the method BasicDBService.createWard(String, int). As the Ward object must not be directly stored after creating, this test checks if a Ward object exists in db, yet it should not.
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)
      • PersistentObject.getObjectID()
      • Ward.getName()
      • Ward.getNumberOfBeds()
      • BasicDBService.getWards()

    • testStoreWardInsertGetWard

      @Test public void testStoreWardInsertGetWard()
      Attempts to insert and get a Ward object using the BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject) and BasicDBService.getWard(long) methods. Test succeeds if
      1. storing the Ward object succeeds
      2. the number of all Ward objects in db increases by one
      3. getting the Ward object via its objectID succeeds
      4. the given Ward object is part of all Ward objects via BasicDBService.getWards()
      5. the received Ward object matches the expected one
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)
      • BasicDBService.getWards()
      • BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject)
      • BasicDBService.getWard(long)
      • Ward.getName()
      • Ward.getNumberOfBeds()
      • PersistentObject.getObjectID()

    • testStoreWardUpdateGetWard

      @Test public void testStoreWardUpdateGetWard()
      Attempts to update and get a Ward object using the BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject) and BasicDBService.getWard(long) methods. Test succeeds if
      1. storing the Ward object succeeds
      2. the number of all Ward objects in db does not change
      3. getting the Ward object via its objectID succeeds
      4. the given Ward object is part of all Ward objects via BasicDBService.getWards()
      5. the received Ward object matches the expected one
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)
      • BasicDBService.getWards()
      • BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject)
      • BasicDBService.getWard(long)
      • Ward.setName(String)
      • Ward.getName()
      • Ward.setNumberOfBeds(int)
      • Ward.getNumberOfBeds()
      • PersistentObject.getObjectID()

    • testGetWardNegativeInvalid

      @ParameterizedTest(name="getWard with invalid OID values - #{index} - Arg={0}") @ValueSource(longs={-9223372036854775808L,-42L,0L,0L}) public void testGetWardNegativeInvalid(long input)
      Attempts to get a Ward object using the method BasicDBService.getWard(long) with invalid objectIDs (i.e. a negative number, PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID, and 0 [should result in no entry in db]).
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.getWard(long)
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)

    • testGetWardPositiveInvalid

      @ParameterizedTest(name="getWard with invalid OID values - #{index} - Arg={0}") @ValueSource(longs=9223372036854775807L) public void testGetWardPositiveInvalid(long input)
      Attempts to get a Ward object using the method BasicDBService.getWard(long) with a positive, huge OID [should result in no entry in db].
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.getWard(long)
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)

    • testSetNameInvalid

      @ParameterizedTest(name="setName with invalid lastname - #{index} - Arg={0}") @NullAndEmptySource @ValueSource(strings={" ","\t","\n"}) public void testSetNameInvalid(String input)
      Attempts to set the Ward's name to an invalid value (i.e. null or ""). See Ward.setName(String) for description.
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)
      • Ward.setName(String)

    • testGetSetName

      @Test public void testGetSetName()

      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createWard(String, int)
      • Ward.setName(String)
      • Ward.getName()

    • testSetNumberOfBedsInvalid

      • Ward.setNumberOfBeds(int)
